runs.comm: on a length, just outside off, Sharma lets it angle away into the keeper's gloves
left alone outside off again as Irfan pitches a little fuller
first touch of bat on ball. Irfan bowls at 142ks, just outside off, and Sharma defends from the crease

first runs. First bits of anxiety. Sharma opens the face on this, gets it square of third man, looks for a non-existent second, and luckily he has slipped a touch. He then turns down the second that was never on
Dhawan off the mark right away. On a length, outside off, Dhawan opens the face fort a single to third man
some seam for Irfan. From a length, just outside off, beats the edge on the defensive push. Akmal fumbles. Good job Sharma hadn't edged it then

great typical Pakistani drama. Sohail swings this one in. Middle and leg. Everybody thinks Dhawan has edged it on to the pad. Sohail is appealing for leg-before for pad first. He is signalling for the review, Misbah is telling him, "Hang on I am the captain here." The review has been disallowed by Misbah. Replays show it never hit the pad. Just the bat
more swing, onto the pads, worked away for a single
this one doesn't swing, and starts outside leg. So that will be a wide
middle and leg, on a length, no swing, clipped away for one
strong square drive from Dhawan but he finds the man at point
short of a length, just outside off, left alone
on a length outside off, goes away with the angle, left alone
full outside off, driven with an open face, gets a single to third man. Actually it is off the thick edge
accurate, on off, defended with an open face

lovely short ball by Irfan. At 138ks, angling in towards Dhawan's throat from just short of a length. Dhawan plays well. Drops his wrists. Sways out of its line. Akmal appeals. Out of enthusiasm and not conviction
into the hips now. Dhawan stabs at it and keeps it down
Dhawan survives. Steep bounce from just short of a length. Towards his chest. Dhawan's head falls back, he drops his wrists but fends at it. The thick edge goes wide of second slip
Sharma leaves alone a length ball outside off
length ball, starts around off, swings in a little, defended in front of middle and leg
looks to drive as he gets a bit of width outside off, but the gentle swing back cramps his drive up
short, that's not his job, and Dhawan finds this trajectory easier. Gets a single wide of mid-on
looks to work this length ball to leg, gets a thick leading edge. Soft hands mean it is kept down
and he bowls short again. Sohail has been nervous. This is short at gentle pace, and allows Dhawan the width to cut this for the first boundary of the match
gets away with this one. Full, on the pads, but Dhawan is early into the flick and is hit on the pad
full, on the pads, Sharma flicks it elegantly. In the air but wide of midwicket. Races away to the boundary
on a length, outside off, Sharma gets a stride in, and leaves it be
short this time, just outside off, Sharma sways out of its line
on a length, just outside off, holds its line a little. Sharma respects it, and lets it go through
that's a beauty. Just short of a length, holds its line against the angle. Sharma plays at it, and is beaten. Irfan has missed the shoulder of the bat by an inch. Akmal collects it head high

and Sharma's riposte now. This is exciting. Irfan has pushed him back, beaten him, and now tries the really full one. Sharma is equal to it, and squeeze-drives it between cover and cover-point for four
short, into the rib, pulled away in the air. One bounce to long leg
on a length, outside off, slight movement back in. Sharma is right behind it in defence
tip and run there. Off the hip, wide of midwicket. Gets a single
short of a length, just outside off, defended towards mid-off
heavy ball. Similar short-of-a-length delivery. Hits the shoulder of the bat as Dhawan looks to keep it out
freebie on the pads, but Dhawan misses out. Early into the glance. Gets a leg-bye
and Irfan angles this into the rubs all right. Dhawan manages to keep this one down
on a length, angling in, Dhawan is not caught with his weight back. As a bowler you want them to be hanging back when you have bowled short. Defends this well
hooked away. Not in control of it. A deep square leg would have caught it, but you don't have that many fielders. From head high, top-edged for a six
this is better from Irfan. Gets this to rise towards the chest from just short of a length. Fended by Dhawan. Keeps this down

risky single. Gets an inside edge towards short square leg. Just wide of the man. Dhawan is always looking for the single, sees Sharma is interested too, and they come through. Younis Khan misses the stumps anyway

this one doesn't quite come on as Irfan bowls at 142ks from round the stumps. Sharma has to wait to adjust and plays a square cut wide of third man where Riaz nearly gets the final dive wrong. Keeps the ball in, though
short of a length, on the pads, tucked away off the hip
short of a length again, just outside off, defended back to him

Sharma has a brain freeze. He does that every now and then. Makes up his mind to play a particular shot even before the ball is bowled. Here he has decided this has to be pulled no matter what. The ball is not short enough, he is pulling off the front foot, and the ball gets big on him. The top edge lobs up for a simple catch for Misbah running in from mid-off. A typical Sharma dismissal
looks to cut the first ball he faces. Gets a soft bottom edge towards the slips
short of a length, wide outside off, left alone. This is a great line to bowl to Kohli. Just get it fuller
too short, too slow, too wide. Luckily for Sohail the third man is square and keeps this cut down to just one run
full and straight. Nearly a yorker. Kept out with a closed face
on a length, just outside off, angling away, left alone by Kohli
short of a length, outside off, good bounce. Kohli is off his feet as he pushes this to cover
opens the face on a length ball, gets a single to third man
this is angling into the pads, and Dhawan has looked to play an exaggeratedly wrist flick. The short square leg gets interested but he has managed to get this fine of the man. Gets four to fine leg
tucks him up with a shortish delivery. The hand comes off the bat as he defends
short of a length, just outside off, defended from the crease
short of a length, outside off, defended with a slightly open face. The half-and-half bat
short of a length, outside off, the half-and-half bat again, gets a thick edge that goes wide of the second slip for a single
short of a length, pitches outside leg, Dhawan looks to tuck this away, and is beaten by the pace. Adjusts his box after he is hit in that general area
slightly fuller, on the pads, glanced away to fine leg for one
short of a length, just outside off, Kohli gets right behind it, and defends this towards mid-on
gentle straight ball on the pads, worked away for an easy single
legbreak that doesn't turn much, at 92ks, defended in front of off. The length has drawn him forward
slightly shorter, slight hint of turn, defended to cover
diving save from ever lovable Younis Khan at cover. Keeps them in their creases

Oh nearly there for Shah. Slightly short, Kohli pulls but this is not the length to pull. So the ball goes in the air, and down the ground. Yasir Shah charges towards it from long-on. Running in front and to his right. The ball begins to drop alarmingly as he gets closer. He dives. Gets hands to it, but it is by his shoe laces and he is diving. Can't hold on. Really difficult chance. Would have been an absolute blinder had he controlled this. Would have been one for the ages
short of a length, worked away for an easy single
on the pads, and Dhawan takes an other single. He is bedding in here. Looking comfortable

this is perfect line to Kohli. They have kept him quiet there. Bowling outside off where he is suspect. The ill-advised pull was a result of that. Kohli can't do anything to this. Pushes it towards mid-on, but an overthrow from there has released the pressure a bit
pulled  away off the hip for a single

outside off again, making Kohli stretch if he wants a drive. Kohli drives. Drives solidly. But can't beat the strong cover field. This is a good contest. They have got their plans right against Kohli. Can they keep executing them for long enough?
No they can't keep executing them long enough. Sohail digs this one in short. At 134ks. That's meat and drink. Kohli pulls this wide of midwi9cket. And just like that all the pressure evaporates
on a length, outside off, defended with a slightly open face
flighted, 88ks, middle and leg, driven to long-on
flatter delivery, Kohli picks it early, goes back, punches this down to long-on
flighted outside off, Dhawan plays with an open face, placing this wide of point for a single
slows it down this time, flights it on middle and leg, defended by Kohli
topspinner, 98ks, on off, Kohli goes back with the trajectory and defends it
and Kohli picks the length early again, and works this from outside off into the leg side for a single. Slightly too flat and too short from Afridi
sharp. 139ks. On a length, on off. Kohli is hurried into this push. Can't beat mid-on
short of a length, Kohli gets inside its line and tucks it away square for a single

quick delivery again. At 140ks. Dhawan is clearly hurried into the short delivery. Not enough width there. Dhawan cuts in the air. Wide of the diving point fieldsman, Shehzad. Riaz applauds the effort
short of a length, into the pads, worked away for an easy single

short, midriff high, 136ks, pulled away in front of square. Dhawan pushes Kohli for the second. Kohli trusts his partner's call. The fielder is Younis Khan. Has Dhawan picked on the arm of, well, the elder statesman?
short of a length, on off, defended from the crease
flighted, angling in, driven for an easy single to long-on
driven hard towards cover, misfielded by Shehzad, and that has slowed the ball down enough to let Kohli comes back for the second before Irfan can lumber in from long-off
bad ball. Pitched outside leg. Would have been wide had Kohli not swept this away for four
into the pads again, and worked away for a single
open face there to a length ball outside off. Dhawan is playing this innings with great control. The game is back to his pace after he has struggled throughout the Australian summer
defended off the back foot
quick, but into the pads, pushed straight of mid-on for one

short of a length, tucked away off the hip, and this time Koihli initiates a second through quick running. These two have run really well. This ball has gone just outside 30 yards and they have rushed back
short of a length, widish, punched away to point
nice drive as he moves across to cover the line of this length ball. Gets a single to sweeper-cover
bouncer, middle and leg, Dhawan ducks under it. That's a sharp delivery, and not too short either
heavy ball. Short of a length, at the stumps, hits the shoulder of the bat
short of a length, on the pads, worked away for an easy single
first sign of jumpiness shown by Dhawan. Jumps out of the crease a little too early. Is beaten in the flight as Afridi drags the length back, but he recovers well and gets a single with an open face
short, Kohli goes back to pull, but is hurried into it by the 102ks pace. Gets a thick inside edge for a couple
worked down the ground off the back foot
angling into the pads, worked away into the leg side
nicely driven to long-off for a single. India are doing a good milking job right now

gets an inside edge. Kohli goes back to that half-and-half bat to a shortish delivery just outside off. It hits the inside edge, and onto the pad. Look at the urgency, though. He is still looking for single. Dhawan sends him back
this is slightly shorter, slightly wider, and Kohli can open the face on this without trouble
short, not too wide, and Dhawan can't beat point with the cut

bad ball. Dhawan has worked hard enough to get the odd bad ball. He tries a sharp short ball, but angles it too far down leg. Dhawan could have let it go for a wide, but he helps it along for four to fine leg
short, not too wide, cut away to third man for one
opens the face on this shortish delivery, gets a single to third man
flat and full, but gets some drift into the pads. Kohli is beaten on the flick and is hit on the pad
nice drift into the pads, and slight turn away towards off. Respectfully pushed to cover
nice bowling again. He looks like he is bowling full, but the ball dips and you are not quite close to the pitch of the ball. And you have to play it with caution
drops this one slightly short and is punched away to deep cover

short again, Dhawan plays this superbly. Rocks back early as he has picked the length early, and then punches this in front of cover even though there is no room available. Beats the man and gets four
tossed up on off, and defended back to him
length ball, outside off, Kohli drives this to point
short of a length, angling in, he lets it come on and then opens the face on it for a single. Uses the pace, which is clocked at 148ks
goes back into the crease to play this shortish ball but he is quick to steal the single as he has placed this wide of cover
runs another shortish ball down to third man for a single
slower ball, on a length, outside off, at 14ks, driven to deep cover. Adjusts his shot well after realising the drop in the pace
Kohli looks for that single to third man again, but this time the fielder at point has been moved finer and denies him that single
down the wicket, right to its pitch, pushes this down to long-off for one

lovely shot. Nothing wrong with this ball. It is on a length, short of driving length, and is turning away slightly from outside off. Kohli, though, has come down the wicket, made room, and driven this over cover for four
flatter quicker delivery, defended by Kohli

even quicker, but Kohli has played an even better shot. If you are Yasir Shah, you can be forgiven for feeling excited. Kohli has made room to cut this but this is neither short nor wide. He plays it impossibly late, from in front of off, and places this past point
into the pads, he goes deep into the crease, and works it to leg for one
flighted on middle and leg, clipped away to deep midwicket for one

that's fifty from Dhawan. He has looked composed and sharp. Looks to cut, gets a bit of a bottom edge. Runs the one. Gets a big applause from India's viewing balcony. Only his second international fifty on tour, but he has hardly looked like the man who has fumbled his way through Australia for more than two months
short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover
shortish again, Kohli opens the face, can't beat the point who has moved finer to control his dab to third man
slightly too short, slightly too wide, cut away in front of square for a single
good bouncer, not too short, Dhawan doesn't have enough time to line it up. Sways out of its line. Rehearses the ramp after it has passed him
uppish square cut but the man at point doesn't have a chance. This is ordinary bowling. Giving him width and also the length. Dhawan gets stuck in this and lets it fly over point
flat, into the pads, helped away
down the wicket, drives this to long-on
full, drift in, some dip, Kohli defends respectfully
comes down the wicket, not quite to its pitch and plays a bit of a check drive down the ground. To the right of Irfan it goes at long-off. And he obviously struggles with the dive, and concedes four
full, on the pads, clipped away for a single that brings up his fifty. Another controlled knock. This partnership has set India up
looks to sweep, is beaten by the really full delivery, there is an appeal for leg-before, but this is missing leg
on a length, Kohli stays back, pushes this wide of cover for one
short of a length, middle and leg, defended to leg
bouncer, Kohli pulls out of the pull at the last moment. Wided
slower ball, Kohli is caught in the crease to this fuller delivery. Beaten on the outer edge
short of a length, angling away, runs it down to third man
on a length, into the pads, gets a leg-bye
down the wicket, not quite to the pitch of the ball, pushes this to short straight midwicket
slower in the air, Dhawan is out of his crease again, gets a single to long-on
topspinner. Dhawan is looking to make room, and the ball turns from leg to off. He has to defend this back
picked away off the pads for a single
not quite to the pitch of this legbreak, but he beats the man at cover with an open face and gets a single
on a length, outside off, punched away, but can't beat short cover
dropped towards cover, takes a quick single Afridi's throw hits Kohli in the back. The crowd boos. But Kohli is smiling. Afridi is there checking on Kohli. This is not war. Well done lads
short ball, gets high, head high, beats the attempted ramp by Dhawan
short of a length, defended
short of a length, angling away from Dhawan, pushed into the covers for one
dug in short, pulled away to deep midwicket for one. That's hundred for this partnership
full, nearly a yorker, Kohli waits for this to slide past the diving short straight cover, and then takes a single
down the wicket, yorked by him, played back to Shah who strangely doesn't throw the ball at the stumps even though Dhawan is out of the crease
that's good running again for this second run. Played between deep square and deep midwicket, and they are lightning quick to beat this direct hit from Riaz at the non-striker's end
flighted around off, slows it down, Dhawan defends
short, on the pads, worked away for an easy single
flat legbreak, driven to long-off for a single
short and wide, punched away in front of deep cover
slows it down, gets some turn away from off, defended to cover
some turn again, Kohli goes back to push this to cover
flighted on middle and off, pushed to long-off for one
short of a length, Dhawan goes back to punch it to long-on
shortish again, Kohli is back and waiting and gets a single to long-on
middle and leg, nicely placed wide of deep midwicket for two
overpitched, driven to long-on for one
down the wicket, lovely shot. He is right to the pitch of it, chips it over midwicket for four

surrealy play. Kettleborough is trying to hold on to his hat, Dhawan is moving away from the stumps, and it seems this is going to be a dead ball. Shah, though, lets go. Turns out Dhawan is looking to make room. This is outside off, Dhawan comes back to his original mark and drives this between cover and mid-off
worked to leg for an easy single
shortish, flat, defended from the crease
tossed up outside off, played with an open face for a single
overpitched, outside leg, and there is more superb running. Just wide of midwicket, and the hare back for the second
short, wide, and Kohli is not going to miss out. Cut away to the left of deep cover for four
tossed up on the pads, defended back. Just wasn't quite the half-volley, and Kohli had to be careful

quicker, Kohli is back even though the ball is full. Worked towards midwicket. Dhawan wants a single. Kohli sends him back. This is Kohli's. Dhawan dives but can't beat the throw. Just the fillip Pakistan needed. Turns out Kohli has sold him down the river. He has started out for the single, but realises late that it is not on. And Shehzad is quick and accurate with the throw
Kohli drives this wide of deep cover for two
Raina is off the mark with a soft bunt towards point
short of a length, stays back to defend
short of a length, into the pads, gets a single
tossed up on the pads, worked away for a single to deep midwicket
nice drift in towards middle, driven to long-off for one
full, middle and leg, played on the walk, gets another single
short, pushed down to long-on for one
short again, pushed down to long-on again
nicely tossed up, gets some dip too, and Raina defends as it is turning back in
nice flight again, this time Raina places it wide of cover

now brace for a familiar comment. Akmal has dropped a catch. This is a superb delivery for a part-time bowler. On a length, dipping, turning enough to take the edge, but Akmal - the part-time keeper - drops it. Just grabs at it. The ball hits the thumb as opposed to the glove accepting the ball. These deflections are never easy, but you expect them to be taken at international level
into the pads, defended
short, flat, punched away square of deep cover for two
angling into the pads, worked away for one

looks to pull one that is not nearly short enough. Gets a thick inside edge. They have seen Irfan is chasing this from short fine, and they pick on him. They take the third. There might have been a run-out recently, but India are aggressive with the running
into the pads and worked away for a easy single
short, stays back to punch this away into the leg side
flat again, Kohli stays back to work this away for a single
slowed down, defended to leg as it turns back in
down the wicket, the mid-off is up, but he can't beat the man. Plays along the ground

Shah is standing in at the short square boundary. This is strange. Really elementary. Raina doesn't get all of this pull, and it would have been a sitter had Yasir Shah been at the boundary at deep midwicket. In stead he gets into this acrobatic effort, which looks good on TV, and all he manages to do is tip it over the bar for a six
Raina drives this down the ground for one now
on a length, just outside off, pushed straight to cover, and Raina sends him back
short of a length, stays back to work this to leg for one
shortish again, but can't beat the short straight midwicket with the punch
flighted around off, defended back to Afridi
quicker, flatter, worked away to leg for one
topspinner, played with an open face to short third man
short of a length, on off, Raina is hopping and gets a thick edge to third man
short of a length, angling in, Kohli defends from the crease
shortish, wide, punched away to deep cover
Raina moves across and stays back to a ball that is not short and skids through. Just about gets some bat on it, or he was a dead duck
short of a length, widish, opens the face on it, gets as single to deep cover
short, wide, cut away to deep cover
starts with a wide yorker that goes for a single to mid-off
length ball, on off, angling away, driven wide of deep cover for two
short of a length, angling away, played straight to Shehzad at point. Raina wants one but is sent back in time. There is no run on here
shortish, gets the width the angle away from him, but can't beat Shehzad at point with the but
ungainly pull. Raina is not liking this bit of extra bounce and pace from Irfan. In front of his rib, his head falls away, and is hit on the splice. Mid-on keeps this to a dot
another ungainly pull but this time Raina has moved inside the line and managed to place this wide of square leg for one
another pull, not in total control again, but this time he clears mid-on with ease. He clears the front leg and swings as hard as he can. The first boundary of this Powerplay
another pull. The best shot among the last four pulls. Gets a single to deep square leg. Rolls his wrists on this
beats him for pace and angle and hits him high on the pad with a short-of-a-length delivery
beats him all ends up. This is at 145ks, short of a length, and cuts back in to accentuate the angle to beat the inside edge of the bat of the well-settled Kohli. It has bounced over the stumps
short of a length, on off, stays back to defend
on a length, just outside off, pushed wide of the man at mid-off for cover
after three good Powerplay overs, Pakistan release the pressure. Half-volley outside leg with the short fine leg up. Kohli will take that, thank you very much. A slower ball gone wrong. At 126ks
back to short of a length and outside off, defended to cover-point
short, wide, but gets big on his cut, and Kohli can't time or place it
full, outside off, pushed slightly wide of mid-off and gets a single

Irfan gets away with it. Tries a slower short ball that neither gets up nor is aimed at the stumps. Raina pulls from outside leg, but can't beat short fine leg. Three feet either side and this would have been four
another bouncer, but this one is a quick one. Raina ducks it, and he is wided on height
shortish outside off, and because Raina has been backing away he struggles to reach this one. Gets a single off the toe end
short of a length, outside off, Raina is off his feet to open the face to point for one
short of a length, angling in towards top of off, Kohli defends from the crease. No run
angling in, short of a length, bunts this to leg for one
short, headed towards the head, Raina pulls without his eyes on the ball, gets a single
short of a length, quick, heavy ball, Kohli gets nothing to work with. Defended to cover
full, outside off, driven to mid-off, he charges through for a single
Kohli pulls but this is not short enough and also skids through. Gets a single to deep midwicket
down the wicket to clips this wide of deep midwicket for two
short of a length, into the pads, worked away for a single
short of a length, some turn, punched to long-on for one
quick legbreak into the pads, worked away for one
slightly slower, driven to long-off for another single
quick, flat, on the pads, helped away for a single
down the wicket, gets too close to the ball, so he places it wide of long-on, and comes back for two. More at home against spin, is Raina
Raina leaves the crease again, and this time he has maintained some distance between himself and the pitch of the ball. Enough room for him to swing the bat, and he goes over the midwicket boundary
legbreak, flat, middle and leg, worked away for a single
driven inside-out to long-off to move to 99
flat short ball, quick too, hit to midwicket in the circle

that's it. Kohli becomes the first Indian to score a hundred in a World Cup match against Pakistan. Short of a length. Punched to long-on. Raina is celebrating more than Kohli, running with his hand raised. Kohli raises his arms and just soaks in the applause. He has scored a hundred each time he has batted in Adelaide on this tour
Raina slog-sweeps. Raiona top-edges. Raina clears the short square boundary
that's fifty for Raina. Knocks the India crest on his chest after working this for an easy single
short of a length, Kohli can't beat point with this punch
tossed up on off, driven to long-off for a single
quicker bowl angling away, Raina opens the face, gets a single to short third man

Pakistan are reviewing this. Raina is backing away, Sohail follows him, Raina is still inside the line so far has Sohail has gone down leg. There is a huge long shout for a catch at the wicket. Gould doesn't give it. Nor does he call it a wide. Pakistan challenge the call. Definitely no bat or glove on the replay. Nor the thigh pad. Might have clicked the pocket on the way
shortish and follows Raina again as he backs away. The ball skids through and stays low. Beats Raina
this time Raina moves the other way. He gets inside the line of a length ball and dunks it over short fine leg for four
this time Raina moves away from the stumps, making room, and hits this length ball for four through mid-off. After two dots, this over has been rearranged
slower ball, Raina gets inside the line again, gets a meaty top edge to the right of long leg for four
full, middle and leg, driven wide of deep midwicket for a couple
Kohli has made up his mind it is time to go. Stands his ground, gets under a length ball anglin into him, and drives it over midwicket for four

full toss, highish, Kohli bends his knees to run it down to third man. Boos around the ground as this is not called a no-ball. And this is a bad error by the umpires. So clearly a no-ball. Almost chest high. Possibly not given because he bent
bouncer, Raina gets inside the line, and places it between deep midwicket and long leg. Gets four more
full toss, on off, drilled to deep midwicket for one
short-arm pull to one short of a length. Gets it to deep midwicket on the bounce
slower ball gone wrong. That's a big high full toss. Raina gets under it easily. Called no-ball and warned for the beamer. Had the first one been spotted, this would have been the end of Irfan
another full toss but shin high, worked to deep square leg for one
finally a yorker. And it is a dot. Wide yorker, squeezed under his bat

Kohli is gone. Gets a wide half-volley that he is not quite close to. He edges it and Pakistan finally hold on to an offering from Kohli. Kohli raises his bat to the crowd as he walks off. Big innings in a big match
full toss, thigh high, hit straight to midwicket
drilled away. In typical Dhoni fashion, Stays back and brings the bottom hand into this punch. Length ball again, and sent between mid-off and cover
on a length, into the stumps, played straight to midwicket again
short, tucked away off the hip, gets two, wide of deep square
full toss, on off, he closes the face, but can't beat square leg. Another dot
Riaz has got away with one. Length ball, outside off, slugged away but he has a deep midwicket in place
hurries onto Dhoni, who hits this length ball straight to mid-off. Not enough time to pick his spot
again he is hurried into a shot. Riaz is bowling with some legs. Dhoni mis-hits this length ball to mid-off
slower bouncer, Rain's edge doesn't carry to fine leg. Another single. A good over from Riaz so far
slower short ball, punched away to deep cover for one
short of a length, no room, punched away to deep cover, and despite a fumble by Haris Sohail India get just the one
not called a wide. Great call I say. He has moved inside the line, and he has been beaten outside leg. Might not have been a wide had Raina stood his ground
Raina is gone. Finally to the short ball. But after having scored 74 off 56. This has hurried onto him, and has taken the top edge
good yorker, Dhoni is making room, but can't get anything on this
short of a length, no room, worked to leg for one
the yorker gone wrong. Low full toss, and Dhoni has been waiting. He sends it sailing over midwicket for six

They have missed two chances to run Dhoni and Jadeja out. Poor thinking from Jadeja. He has hit this straight to cover, but doesn't want to run. Dhoni is gone for all money, but Afridi goes for a direct hit as opposed to lobbing it back to Riaz. Now Jadeja goes. Yasir Shah tries the direct hit now, and he too misses
cramps Dhoni up with a shortish delivery. Just the single again
slower ball, wide, Jadeja hits it straight to point. Runs the single now
again tucks Dhoni up with a shortish delivery from round the stumps. This is bowled at 146ks. Dhoni gets just the single to cover
Jadeja has been beaten for pace. Nacking away to hit, and is late on a length ball

slower ball this time at the base of the off stump, and Jadeja is beaten slogging. Beats me why Rahane hasn't come out to bat yet. India might fall 20 short of what they were looking good for. Good bowling by Pakistan over the last five overs
and Dhoni has failed to finish again. This is reaching proportions of concern. Short ball. Beaten for pace. Late into the pull. Top-edges this for an easy catch for mid-off
Sohail is doing the sajda after bowling Rahane out. Slower ball, Rahane makes room to try to hit it over cover, and has the top of the leg stumps disturbed. Will we get another last-over hat-trick?
that's the closest you'll get to a hat-trick without actually getting it. Lovely yorker. Beats Shami. Misses the off stump by a whisker
full toss on off, he just slogs, gets a thick edge for one
slower ball, Ashwin bunts this to leg for one after walking down and realising he is early into the shot
and India reach 300. There has been a 300 in every first innings of this Cup so far. Shami drives this full ball over point and comes back a second
